properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Edwards, IL; White, IL; Posey, IN; Knox, IN; Gallatin, IL; Gibson, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 12 at 11:44AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Driftwood River...East Fork White River...Wabash River...White
River...


.Flooding is underway along several central and southern Indiana
waterways as a result of up to 2 inches of precipitation that fell
Sunday into Monday.  Another precipitation event this Wednesday and
early Wednesday night will bring up to an inch of water, heaviest
south.  This latter event will bring secondary crests to waterways at
some locations and prolong the original crest at others.

The White River will see crests up to about 5 feet above flood stage
and the Wabash will see crests up to about 3 feet.  Predictions are
holding steady for flooding along the lower reaches of the Wabash and
White Rivers to last through the end of next week.  Flooding on the
East Fork White River is expected to be confined to primarily
the Seymour area, with two crests around 14.6 feet.

Today's forecast model run of expected crests is largely similar to
yesterday's.  This will give us crests lower than what we saw in
January.

Flood impacts should mainly be confined to roads near the waterways,
agricultural land, bottomlands, and levees.  Please see the specific
impacts listed for your location of interest below or by going to
the web page described below.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Mount Carmel.
* from Thursday afternoon until further notice.
* At 8:45 AM Wednesday the stage was 17.5 feet.
* Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Thursday afternoon and
continue to rise to near 21.5 feet by Wednesday February 19.
* At 22.0 feet...Flood waters begin to affect residents of East Mt.
Carmel, Indiana. Fifth Street that parallels river closes.  Twin
restaurant along the river also closes.  Several local river roads
flood.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
